description: Here's our spot for archived Dawgman Radio segments
title: Dawgman Radio

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Cyler Miles
episodes.description:
With the news of Washington QB Cyler Miles taking a voluntary leave of absence from UW Football, Dawgman.com's Kim Grinolds and Scott Eklund took a few minutes to talk about what Miles leaving the program will due for the quarterback position, as well as what they saw from the quarterbacks during the Huskies' recent Combine Day. Who stood out? Who is ready to take the lead?

Click on the link below to listen to the 10-minute podcast.

DawgmanRadio: 2/23 Update

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio - 2/23 Update
episodes.description:
In this Monday DawgmanRadio podcast, Kim Grinolds and Scott Eklund spend 15 minutes bringing you up to speed on the latest UW recruiting happenings, as well as talk about the four Husky NFL Combine participants - Danny Shelton, Hauoli Kikaha, Shaq Thompson and Marcus Peters - and how they’ve been progressing. The Boise State opener has been set, and it won’t be on a Saturday!

Click on the link below to listen to the 15-minute podcast.

DawgmanRadio: 2/23 Update

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: 2/18 Update
episodes.description:
The guys from Dawgman.com - Kim Grinolds and Scott Eklund - put together another quick recruiting update in this 11-minute DawgmanRadio podcast. Grinolds spent time down at Starfire in Tukwila watching some Huskies go through some pre-combine work, while Eklund was at Interlake High School watching prospects at a Barton Football workout. What did they see?

Click on the link below to listen to the 11-minute podcast.

DawgmanRadio: Junior Day

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Junior Day
episodes.description:
Kim Grinolds and Scott Eklund sat down Monday and broke down the particulars of Washington’s first Junior Day, held this past weekend. Signing Day was only a couple days in the books, but Chris Petersen and his staff were already hard at work with some of their top targets for 2016.

Click on the link below to listen to this 11-minute podcast.

DawgmanRadio: Junior Day

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: 2/3 Update
episodes.description:
It's less than 24 hours to Signing Day - the first day high school prospects can sign a letter of intent to play college football - and there's some definite storylines to watch when it comes to where the Washington Huskies stand in the Pac-12 recruiting chase. Dawgman.com's Kim Grinolds and Scott Eklund talk about what to expect Wednesday when the faxes are turned on at 7 am Pacific Time.

Click on the link below to listen to this 11-minute podcast.

DawgmanRadio: 2/3 Update

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Pac-12 Recruiting Roundup
episodes.description:
For this DawgmanRadio podcast, Kim Grinolds spoke Friday with Scout.com National Recruiting Analyst Brandon Huffman, who gave us the lowdown on each Pac-12 school and his thoughts as they try and wrap up their 2015 recruiting classes. Huffman went rapid-fire through each program, talking about their top commits, as well as who they might land at this late hour.

Click on the link below to listen to this 14-minute podcast.

DawgmanRadio: Pac-12 Recruiting Roundup

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Recruiting Update
episodes.description:
As Washington winds down to signing day in six days and spring ball around the corner, Dawgman.com will be putting out more DawgmanRadio segments, bite-sized podcasts more specificically-targeted toward a particular subect, topic at hand, sport, etc... Thursday, Kim Grinolds and Scott Eklund took 10 minutes to break down the Huskies' final recruiting targets for the 2015 signing class.

Click on the link below to listen to the quick update.

DawgmanRadio: Recruiting Update

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Recruiting Update
episodes.description:
Due to no radio shows on Sports Radio KJR while the Seahawks are doing their thing, the guys from Dawgman.com - Kim Grinolds and Scott Eklund - put together a 30-minute podcast to bring everyone up to speed on Washington's 2015 recruiting class. They talked about Benning Potoae, Chris Warren, Jaylinn Hawkins, Xavier Castille, and the prospects that are officially visiting Montlake this weekend.

Click on the link below to listen to the full half-hour podcast.

DawgmanRadio: Recruiting Update

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Post-Season Wrap
episodes.description:
BELLEVUE - With no Sports Radio KJR shows this week, Dawgman.com’s Kim Grinolds and Chris Fetters decided some radio was still in order, especially with all the news coming out of the Cactus Bowl loss, including the departure of Troy Williams and Kendyl Taylor. How will UW finish out their 2015 recruiting class? What will be the main storylines heading into spring camp?

Click on the link below to listen to the full 34-minute podcast.

DawgmanRadio: Post-Season Wrap

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Cactus Bowl
episodes.description:
TEMPE - Dawgman.com’s Kim Grinolds and Chris Fetters broke down the good, bad, and mostly ugly, from Washington’s 30-22 loss to Oklahoma in the TicketCity Cactus Bowl Friday night at Sun Devil Stadium. Washington spurned a great opportunity to head into the off-season with momentum; now there’s nothing but questions.

Click on the link below to listen to the full 35-minute podcast.

DawgmanRadio: Cactus Bowl

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: WSU
episodes.description:
SOMEWHERE OUTSIDE COLFAX, WASH. - The guys from Dawgman.com - Kim Grinolds and Chris Fetters - were joined by special guest Jeff ‘Sweet Lou’ Carr as we finished off a road trip to the Palouse with this DawgmanRadio podcast. It was recorded in the middle of the night, so bear with them.

They talked about the mostly good and sometimes bad in Washington’s 31-13 win over WSU in the 107th Apple Cup, as well as where the Huskies may find themselves in a week when the bowl pairings are announced.

Click on the link below to listen to the full half-hour podcast.

DawgmanRadio: WSU

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Oregon State
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - Kim Grinolds, Scott Eklund, Chris Fetters, and Marshall Cherrington of Dawgman.com burnt the midnight oil and broke down all the highlights and things still to work on in Washington’s 37-13 win over the Oregon State Beavers Saturday night.

To listen in on the 26-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Oregon State

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Arizona
episodes.description:
TUCSON - Dawgman.com's Kim Grinolds and Chris Fetters dug through the bones and picked apart Washington's 27-26 loss to the Arizona Wildcats Saturday afternoon at Arizona Stadium. Despite playing the 'Cats in nearly every phase of the game, they were undone in the final seconds.

To listen in on the 20-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Arizona

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: UCLA
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - It was confusing, it was painful to watch. 'It' was Washington's 44-30 loss to UCLA Saturday night at Husky Stadium, their third-straight at home this year, and the guys from Dawgman.com - Kim Grinolds, Scott Eklund, Chris Fetters, and Marshall Cherrington - rehashed all the main talking points post-game in this latest DawgmanRadio podcast.

To listen in on the 30-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: UCLA

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Colorado
episodes.description:
BOULDER, Colo. - It wasn't pretty to start, but it's all about how you finish - and by that measure the Washington Huskies finished well in their 38-23 win over Colorado Saturday at Folsom Field. Dawgman.com's Kim Grinolds and Chris Fetters dissected the talking points and narratives in this 24-minute DawgmanRadio podcast.

To listen in on the recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Colorado

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: ASU
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - Scott Eklund, Chris Fetters, and Marshall Cherrington of Dawgman.com picked through the bones of Washington's 24-10 loss to the Arizona State Sun Devils early Sunday morning. Was there anything the Huskies could hang their hats on despite the defeat? How did Troy Williams do in his first career start?

To listen in on the 34-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: ASU

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Oregon
episodes.description:
SALEM, Ore. - Kim Grinolds and Chris Fetters of Dawgman.com broke down the good, bad, and downright ugly from Washington's 45-20 loss at the hands of Oregon - their 11th-straight win over the Huskies dating back to 2004 - Saturday night at Autzen Stadium in Eugene. How far away is UW from competing at Oregon's level? Is there a real quarterback controversy? We touch on those topics, and more.

To listen in on the 33-minute post-game podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Oregon

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Cal
episodes.description:
BERKELEY, Calif. - There was tons to dissect Saturday night from Memorial Stadium, as Dawgman.com's Kim Grinolds and Chris Fetters broke down Washington's impressive 31-7 win over the California Golden Bears. How did it all go so right for the 5-1 Huskies? What were the keys on offense, defense, and special teams?

To listen in on the 25-minute post-game podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Cal

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Stanford
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - There was plenty to talk about after Stanford’s 20-13 win Saturday over Washington. Did we start to see who Washington is on offense, defense, and special teams? What can we expect moving forward? Kim Grinolds, Kyle Grinolds, Scott Eklund, Marshall Cherrington, and Chris Fetters discuss all that and more in this DawgmanRadio podcast.

To listen in on the 34-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Stanford

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: GSU
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - Kim Grinolds, Kyle Grinolds, Scott Eklund, Marshall Cherrington, and Chris Fetters once again sat at the post-game roundtable, but this time it was a half-hour re-hash of Washington's 45-14 win over the Georgia State Panthers Saturday at Husky Stadium. People may just look at the score and think this game was by-the-numbers, but it most definitely was anything but.

To listen in on the 30-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Stanford

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Illinois
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - In this episode of DawgmanRadio, Kim Grinolds, Kyle Grinolds, Scott Eklund, Chris Fetters, and Marshall Cherrington bring a packed post-game show from high above the field at Husky Stadium as Washington defeated Illinois 44-19 in front of an announced crowd of 62,325.

To listen in on the 27-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Illinois

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: EWU
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - At times it was wonderful; at times it was downright hideous. Washington eventually saw out their 59-52 win over Eastern Washington Saturday at Husky Stadium, but it wasn't without its substantial peaks and valleys. In this DawgmanRadio podcast, Kim Grinolds, Scott Eklund, and Chris Fetters spend over a half hour dissecting all the main talking points during the game, as well as after.

To listen in on the 33-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: EWU

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Hawaii
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - HONOLULU - It wasn’t what they expected, but a win is what the Washington Huskies wanted, and they got that - barely. Dawgman.com’s Kim Grinolds and David Samek talk post-game as the Huskies hang on to defeat the Hawaii Rainbow Warriors 17-16 in front of 36,411 fans at Aloha Stadium.

To listen in on the quick 10-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Hawaii

episodes.title: DawgmanRadio: Fall Scrimmage
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - The guys from Dawgman.com - Kim Grinolds, Scott Eklund, and Chris Fetters - took time out after a two-hour UW scrimmage Saturday afternoon at Husky Stadium to recap what they saw, who stood out, who needs work, and who are making moves now that the Huskies are nearly into their third week of fall camp.

To listen in on the nearly 20-minute recap podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Fall Scrimmage

episodes.title: Fall Camp: DawgmanRadio
episodes.description:
SEATTLE - Kim Grinolds, Scott Eklund, and Chris Fetters of Dawgman.com took time after Washington's first day of Fall Camp to dissect the good, bad, and the ugly of what they saw. As always, it was a bit of a mixed bag, but the good certainly outweighed the rest of it.

To listen in on the 35-minute podcast, click on the link below.

DawgmanRadio: Vegas Baby!
